maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more host bus adapter (HBA) initiator ports.

The Get-InitiatorPort cmdlet gets and displays host bus adapter (HBA) initiator ports, such as SAS, FibreChannel, and iSCSI ports. Typically used either for connection to an iSCSI target in the case of iSCSI, or for in the management of masking sets in the case of FibreChannel.
Specifies the node address for the initiator.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the type of the connection. Acceptable values are: Other, FibreChannel, iSCSI, and SAS.
To specify a custom connection type, specify the Other value and specify a non-NULL value for the OtherConnectionTypeDescription property.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the type of the connection. Acceptable values are: Other, FibreChannel, iSCSI, and SAS.
To specify a custom connection type, specify the Other value and specify a non-NULL value for the OtherConnectionTypeDescription property.
Specifies the instance name of the initiator.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the ObjectID of the initiator.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the VirtualDisk object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter a VirtualDisk CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-VirtualDisk cmdlet.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the iSCSIConnection object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter an iSCSIConnection CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-IscsiConnection cmdlet.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the iSCSITarget object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter an iSCSITarget CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-IscsiTarget cmdlet.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the type of the connection. Acceptable values are: Other, FibreChannel, iSCSI, and SAS.
To specify a custom connection type, specify the Other value and specify a non-NULL value for the OtherConnectionTypeDescription property.
Specifies the instance name of the initiator.
Specifies the node address for the initiator.
Specifies the ObjectID of the initiator.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the VirtualDisk object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter a VirtualDisk CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-VirtualDisk cmdlet.
Specifies the iSCSIConnection object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter an iSCSIConnection CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-IscsiConnection cmdlet.
Specifies the iSCSISession object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter an iSCSISession CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-IscsiSession cmdlet.
Specifies the iSCSITarget object for which you want to get the initiator port. Enter an iSCSITarget CIM object, which is exposed by the Get-IscsiTarget cmdlet.
You can pipe an iSCSIConnection object to the iSCSIConnection parameter.
You can pipe an iSCSISession object to the iSCSISession parameter.
You can pipe an IscsiTarget object to the IscsiTarget parameter.
You can pipe a VirtualDisk object to the VirtualDisk parameter.
This cmdlet returns an object that represents the initiator port you specified.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1: Get all initiator ports --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-InitiatorPort InstanceName NodeAddress PortAddress ConnectionType ------------ ----------- ----------- -------------- ROOT\ISCSIPRT\0000_0 iqn.1991-05.com.contoso:... ISCSI ANY PORT iSCSI

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets all available initiator ports.

command:example.maml:title: -- Example 2: Get all initiator ports, and filter the display --
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-InitiatorPort | Select-Object -Property NodeAddress,ConnectionType | Format-Table -AutoSize NodeAddress ConnectionType ----------- -------------- iqn.1991-05.com.microsoft:johnj99-pc2.contoso.com iSCSI

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets all available initiator ports. selects only the NodeAddress and ConnectionType properties, and then displays this information.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets properties on the InitiatorPort object.
The Set-InitiatorPort cmdlet sets properties on the InitiatorPort object.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies the new node address for the initiator port.
Sends items from the interactive window down the pipeline as input to other cmdlets. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
To send items from the interactive window down the pipeline, click to select the items and then click OK. Shift-click and Ctrl-click are supported.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1: Change the node address --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $address = (Get-InitiatorPort) PS C:\> $address | Select NodeAddress PS C:\> Set-InitiatorPort -NodeAddress $address.NodeAddress -NewNodeAddress "iqn.test2" NodeAddress ----------- iqn.1991-05.com.contoso:test-pc2.contoso.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uses a node address from the Get-InitiatorPort cmdlet as input.
